name: Ilam Park to Dovedale Stepping Stones Trail, Ilam Park

ai.summary: A scenic 11.7 km moderate hike from Ilam Park to the Dovedale Stepping Stones, following the River Dove through the Peak District with limestone scenery, a gentle valley ascent, and options to explore the Stepping Stones crossing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-defined footpaths and grassy trails along the River Dove, with sections of rocky and uneven terrain, forestry tracks, and occasional gradient. The route includes a crossing near the Dovedale gorge via the Stepping Stones; paths can be muddy, especially after rain, and some sections are uneven and stony.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy boots with good grip and watch for slippery rocks near the stepping stones. Weather in the Peak District can change quickly; carry layers and a waterproof. Stay on marked paths, supervise children and dogs, and take care on narrow ledges and stepping-stone crossings; check accessibility after heavy rain as stones can be slick.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) offer the best conditions and most daylight; winter can be muddy, icy, and less pleasant.

seo.title: Ilam Park to Dovedale Stepping Stones Trail – 11.7 km Peak District Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover an 11.7 km moderate hike from Ilam Park to the Dovedale Stepping Stones in the Peak District. Scenic limestone gorge, river crossings, safety tips, gear checklist and best seasons.
seo.h1: Ilam Park to Dovedale Stepping Stones Trail
